info.question: A subnet maps to how many AZs?
When you terminate an EC2 instance, its attached root EBS volume will be deleted by default?
If you don't want the root EBS volume to be deleted when you terminate its EC2 instance, you can do which of these?
answers: uncheck the Delete on Termination checkbox in the console
use the cli to change the delete on termination status for the volume
you can't make the root volume continue to exist if you terminate its EC2 instance
correctAnswer: uncheck the Delete on Termination checkbox in the console

info.question: Which EC2 status check verifies that your EC2 instance is reachable?
Which EC2 status check verifies that you can get network packets to your instance?
If this status check fails there may be an issue with the infrastructure of the EC2 instance, such as power, OS, or networking?
Which EC2 status check verifies that your instance is accepting traffic?
Basic monitoring of an EC2 instance occurs every _____ minutes?
Detailed monitoring of an EC2 instance occurs every _____ minutes, and costs extra?
EC2 termination protection is _________ by default?
You must do what to get termination protection for your EC2 instance?
answers: explicitly turn it on for that instance
accept the defaults when creating the instance
correctAnswer: explicitly turn it on for that instance

info.question: On an EBS-backed EC2 instance, the default action to take when the EC2 instance is terminated is what?
answers: the EBS root volume is deleted when the EC2 instance is terminated
the EBS root volume remains active when the EC2 instance is terminated
the EBS root volume is inactive but still exists when the EC2 instance is terminated
correctAnswer: the EBS root volume is deleted when the EC2 instance is terminated

info.question: EBS root volumes of the AMIs created by AWS (or the DEFAULT AMIs) _______?
You can use a third party tool (such as bit locker) to encrypt an AWS created AMI?
You can create your own AMI copy of the AWS default AMI and encrypt the root EBS volume using which of these?
answers: you can't encrypt the root EBS volume when creating your own AMI copy

info.question: Additional EBS volumes added to your EC2 instance can be encrypted?
A security group is what?
answers: virtual firewall controlling traffic to your instances
a physical firewall controlling traffic to your instances
correctAnswer: virtual firewall controlling traffic to your instances

info.question: An EC2 instance can have how many security groups?
Any change applied to a security group is applied when?
answers: after the time to live (TTL) expires
when the security groups for you instance are refreshed

info.question: Security groups are ______?
Since security groups are stateful, any traffic allowed in is __________?
answers: only allowed back out if an outbound rule is defined for that type of traffic

info.question: When you create an inbound security group rule a corresponding outbound rule is also added so that type of traffic is allowed back out again?
With security groups _________?
answers: all traffic is denied by default
all traffic is allowed by default
correctAnswer: all traffic is denied by default

info.question: How do you allow traffic for a specific type of traffic using a security group?
answers: you add a rule for that type of traffic on a specific port using a specific CIDR
you define an IAM role and associate it with the security group
you define an IAM policy and associate it with the security group
correctAnswer: you add a rule for that type of traffic on a specific port using a specific CIDR

info.question: With security groups all outbound traffic is ________ by default?
You can have how many EC2 instances within a security group?
Which do you use to block specific IP addresses access to your EC2 instance?
You cannot block specific IP addresses using security groups?
Using security groups you can specify which types of rules?
